intro: Oxydectes pycnantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bottle tree, is a distinctive member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant is characterized by its thick, bottle-shaped trunk that stores water, and its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsules containing seeds. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
